Reviews.Content: see you next year       pool bar
Reviews.Author: inlovewithbali

Reviews.Content: Clean,Comfortable,Good For Budget Travellers  Location:-It was a great location right on Jl Legian (main street in Kuta). Packed with bars, nightclubs, restaurants, clothes shop, handicrafts galore, salons and local mini markets.Hotel Atmosphere  Rooms:- Clean and comfortableServices  Staff:-OkayBeach:-This is not beach front hotel! But easily walking distance to the beach ;-)I would recommend this hotel for young people and the young at heart on a party holiday in Bali.
Reviews.Author: s0kutatsu

Reviews.Content: freindly place G,day from Perth,I stayed at the Mahtaharri Bungalows,March 2008,when I arrived was at 2am as Garuda was like 5 hours late which sucked,any way on with it I was here for 16 days,on my arrival to my room though only standard I didnt mind as I was in Bali to have fun and not shop around.My first room had no hot water so of I went to the reception and they were happy to change my room even carried my luggage for me,the next room was even better because this room had a single bed and it was king size as well and of course hot water I know it is hot in Bali and it was very humid in March but I still enjoy a hot shower or bath,the room was very clean,my mate who was there at the time was up market than me he had a deluxe room it also was nice,for my room it was spacaious plenty of room shower and bath were good,aircon worked nicely,I must remember to close my door at night though because the mossies like to pay visits to me,but accross the road from the hotel was a mini mart which had some spray so each night I sprayed so I had no problems there after with mossies,and the hotel sprayed the ground at least once a week that I seen for the mossies which was good,I read some one complain about the flys on the fruit were they on drugs as I never even brushed a fly of in all the times I have been to Bali.The staff were great as well all ways had a smile and chat with them,just had to get the right one for a dvd player and barter with him to get a good price,then realising I was better of going to the shopping centre and buying one for 300,000 rph der me lolbut you live and learn.I was also the for nypie day where every thing shut down now that was a experince no one on the streets not even a scooter though you cant leave your hotel at this time,good excuse to drink your duty free alcohol.Any way it is a budget hotel and I recomend to anyone who like to go cheap to Bali,like me Iam going back in August the 20th for 3 weeks this time,also have to say the breakfasts was good,and I all ways seen the staff clean down the tables when someone had finished the breakfast,see ya all soon in Bali,regards Mark Gibson from Perth.
Reviews.Author: wolftrackor

Reviews.Content: Peace and Calm in the Centre of Kuta I had previously stayed at the hotel in April 2007 with my mother and loved the location.I took my husband and two teenage daughters back in Jan 2008 and have already re-booked for Aug 2008 for my husband and I.Don't forget it is a BUDGET HOTEL!I would agree that the rooms could do with some updating, however there were comfortable beds, hot running water, fridge, TV and air conditioning..........what else do you need??The staff are always pleasant and helpful and happy to sit and chat. We have made some wonderful friendships with several of the long standing staff.Breakfast is fine, if you want bacon and eggs you must pay, which works out to about $2AUThe pool and gardens are fantastic, especially with the swim up bar, what a way to spend and afternoon.We thought about staying at a more up market hotel for our return trip in August and then decided that we were more than happy with the hotel so why pay more for pretty well much of the same.Matahari Bungalow's is and will be out hotel of choice.
Reviews.Author: MaynardKalgoorlie

Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel       Peace in the pool
Reviews.Author: Moochsta

Reviews.Content: Try to Forget about it... We stayed at this hotel for 5 days and believe me, this hotel was not pleasant at all.Our room was at the edge of the third floor. The room was very-very basic, thin wall, bad bathroom and hard bed. eventhough we pay for a budget, but we didn't aspect the worst kind of room like this hotel.Just imagine, the airconditioner was in front of the bathroom and not facing the bed, and although we swith on the aircon 24 hours our room wasn't cold at all!For the environment, it's quite okay with a good view of swimming pool. The breakfast was simple but the fried rice served was quite yummy.Overall, if you can find other budget hotel, just forget about Matahari Bungalow.
Reviews.Author: Putra1500

Reviews.Content: Budget with bonus excrement! I booked the hotel from Australia through the Travelagent. Unfortunately they didn't know anything about Matahari Bungalows in Kuta, so we decided the website and photos looked okay for a Budget Hotel, as we were only staying 4 nights before flying back home. We first stayed for 12 nights in Amed on the East coast and thought it would be good to be closer to the airport and sort out the shopping in those last days.We were very disappointed when we arrived. The Deluxe Room we booked looked nothing like the nice photo in their brochure. I wished I had taken photos right then, but I was stunned to say the least, we didn't even unpack.The bathroom was filthy, the toilet had not been cleaned, there was still a brown substance  dried to the seat, hairs and various unidentifyable stuff on the floor as well. The beds, especially the pillows (though they looked clean ), smelled of someone elses old sweat, the whole room was not swept clean. The place was plain,old, no colour, no care, no decorations, grey horse blankets with sheets which were trying to look white, not anything Deluxe  to be seen...I felt sorry for the people staying in the Standard rooms!We went for an upgrade, $20 each per night for a suite, which was cleaner, but it kept raining through the ceiling on to the very slippery tiles. It got eventually fixed, after complaints, complaints and many towels later...Oh, feel like some complementary water for a drink or to clean your teeth? Well, forget it, the super mini fridge is empty, every day. I broke a glass, one of the only two in the whole suite with kitchen and bathroom...I cleaned up the obvious bits with my last towel, but the tiny other fragments were still there the next day after letting reception know about it. (I wanted to avoid injuries to staff, as they rarely wore shoes) Nearly everything is broken, dirty or missing but nothing is getting fixed, Care and Maintenance are words with no meaning in this place. Concerns and complaints were met with blank stares, I had the feeling we were merely tolerated to be there, even though we were paying much more than we originally wanted, just for a cleaner room.The staff was trying, but just smiling doesn't help when there is a problem. I thought that the Management was rather arrogant in their attitude. When my friends credit card was swallowed by the ATM machine, they wanted to charge us 65.000 rupiah for a reverse call to Australia. Alltogether, they were not helpful at all, I just had the feeling no one cared.And don't get me started on the Breakfast, the tables were not cleaned after Hotel Guests left, so you had to sit down with the last person's crumbs, though there was staff standing around. And eggs? You're kidding me, they're extra...the buffet  consisted of grey rice with not a vegetable in sight, toast,jam, coffee, and fruit with flies, or was that flies with the fruit? So we gave up on that too and went elsewhere to eat.I didn't expect too much of a Budget place, but this topped my worst imagination. I do not believe they know the meaning of Customer Service, understand the paying tourist or have any communication skills.Not a place for eldery people either, no handrails leading up the slippery tiled stairs to the suites. To be fair, the garden and pool area was nice, but is there anything really good to say at all about this place? For us, it was  Good Bye  and never again.PS: I feel rather silly now putting up with a Hotel that we were so disappointed with, next time we will contact the Tour Operator...they assured us they would have found us another place of equal value, so take the reading glasses and read the fine print on your vouchers!!!
Reviews.Author: coastar

Reviews.Content: location okay? nice pool.... room??? not sure If you want to shop then the location is good as it is right in the middle of the Kuta shopping area. Rooms are okay? TV and Air con but our room was full of mosquitoes even with the air con on 24 hours. The pool was nice and has stools and a small bar in it. Breakfast was poor. It was not terrible but I would not recommend it to my friends nor would I stay there again. However Bali in itself is so great that even if you are not happy with the Hotel it will not ruin your trip.
Reviews.Author: my3gifts

Reviews.Content: Not recommended i have booked 5 rooms for 3 days at Matahari Bungalowand i have a special request that i want my room in the ground floor because i have two times stay at Matahari Bungalow and room at 2nd floor worse than ground floori booked by phone and they receptionist already approved my reservation (with price Rp 350.000,- for deluxe room)when i came there..i'm very disappointed because 2 rooms in the ground floor already used by other guest (they only have 5 deluxe rooms at ground floor)i complain to receptionist but they didn't care about thati complain to their manager (MR. KAREL) and he also don't care about that..when i tell him (MR KAREL) about how to maintain customer, he say that HE (matahari bungalow) HAVE MUCH CUSTOMER.. very-very arrogant!!!!when i say that i want to write this case to indonesian consumer media ([--]) or the biggest indonesian newspaper (kompas), he still don't carei really disappointed with this hoteli already 2 times stay there.. and this is the third times they do the same mistake (when one of my family say that if someone do the same mistake till 3 times, it just like a donkey.. and MR. KAREL say yes.. he is very arrogant, uncooperative and don't know how to manage hotel)for your information, when i'm at receptionist, i'm hear one of their guest have check-in.. and you know the price?? that guest must pay Rp 350.000,- for standard room.So i think, they sell 2 rooms at ground floor because they can sell more..i hate hotel that money oriented not customer oriented..this hotel type will bankrupt soonso, if u want to stay here.. please re-thinking.. because you can't trust their promise even though they already give you an evidence. because although they know they have a mistake, but they don't care about that..
Reviews.Author: Family_lovers

Reviews.Content: Rooms with paper thin walls and below average service We booked the Matahari Bungalow based on the photos of the property on the website. Don't let looks deceive you!Although we spent only one night there, it was a restless night. The walls of the rooms are paper thin (made of rattan). The person next to our room had his TV on till 3am and though the volume wasn't loud, it felt as if he was watching it in our room! Breakfast was a pathetic spread - bread (a broken toaster was provided), noodles, and crepes (which was replenished at an exceptionally slow pace).To be fair, the layout and design of the hotel is nice but it is easily overshadowed by the poor service. On checking out, we chose to pay in US$ instead of Rupiah but were told we could only settle our bill in Rupiah. The reason we discovered was because they had used a much higher conversion rate!Seek another low budget hotel. Matahari is certainly not worth the money.
Reviews.Author: meanttobeme

Reviews.Content: Exotic Hotel My Swiss BF  I were staying at Matahari Bungalows for 5 days and we were really enjoying our stay there. Marvellous place  location not so far from the Kuta Beach. The room clean  tidy.. The Staffs are very warm  welcome to us. We wont regret staying there. Very exotic place to stay in Kuta, Bali..
Reviews.Author: andria244

Reviews.Content: loved matahari bungalow We came in 1998 for the first time to Matahari Bungalow, Since then we come back every year.The hotel is very clean and good. The staff is very nice and helpful.The restaurant has very much choice, the food is good and the restaurant is very clean.The rooms are clean and good.There are two swimming pools, one for children and one for adults. In the swimming pool there is a bar, where you can get anything you want.There is also a garden, which is very beautiful and nice. We recommend this hotel to everyone.
Reviews.Author: Bommel
